thread.title: Beloved Brooklyn mom dies after slamming SUV into light pole
thread.title_full: Beloved Brooklyn mom dies after slamming SUV into light pole - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Beloved Brooklyn mom dies after slamming SUV into light pole
text:
Ken Murray/NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Investigators believe Mitzi Imbo, 56, may have suffered a seizure or heart attack before she sped up and slammed her 2008 Toyota Rav4 on 24th Ave., slowed near Bath Ave. in Bath Beach Thursday. Ken Murray/NEW YORK DAILY NEWS “She was a mother to all of us,” said a friend of Imbo's son. Previous Next Enlarge A Brooklyn woman who was like a mother to her son’s friends died Thursday when her SUV slammed into a light pole in Brooklyn.
Mitzi Imbo, 56, may have suffered a seizure or heart attack, cops said, at 4:40 p.m. as she drove her 2008 Toyota Rav4 on 24th Ave., slowed near Bath Ave. in Bath Beach and then inexplicably sped up and hit the pole.
“She was a mother to all of us,” said Vincenzo Scalici, 29, one of Imbo’s son Andrew’s pals. “She watched Ranger games with us.”
Related Stories Brooklyn bride 'holding up' after L.I. crash killed groom Pedestrian hit with debris from 2-car crash in Brooklyn
